dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 8083 IH: Assessing Chinese Special Operations Forces Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Murphy of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To modify the requirements of the annual report on military and security developments involving the People’s Republic of China, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Assessing Chinese Special Operations Forces Act of 2022.

section.header: Modification to annual report on military and security developments involving the People's Republic of China
section.text: Section 1202(b) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 (10 U.S.C. 113 note) is amended as follows:

clause.text: by striking A summary and inserting a summary; and
by striking ; and at the end and inserting a semicolon;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
the doctrine, capabilities, organization, and operational employment of the People’s Liberation Army special operations forces.

paragraph.text: In paragraph (8), by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
